Probation.definition: subjection to a period of evaluation and possible termination at the commencement of employment in a position for which one's fitness is to be determined b
Probation.origin: [Middle French, critical examination and evaluation, from Latin probation- probatio , from probare to test, approve, prove]

1 a.definition: subjection to a period of evaluation and possible termination at the commencement of employment in a position for which one's fitness is to be determined

sub_terms.b: subjection to a period of review in the course of employment or education as a result of a violation of standards and with the possibility of dismissal if standards are not met

2 a.definition: the suspension of all or part of a sentence and its replacement by freedom subject to specific conditions and the supervision of a probation officer [it is the intent of the legislature that the granting of shall be a matter of grace conferring no vested right to its continuance ""] compare,

sub_terms.b: probation as a sentence in itself
sub_terms.c: the period or state of being subject to probation [arrested while on ]
